author: NewsWire
text: A highly classified complaint alleging misconduct by U.S. Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard has triggered months of internal debate over how to share the information with Congress, according to people familiar with the matter.
aiSummary: U.S. officials are investigating allegations involving intelligence chief Tulsi Gabbard, but the extreme sensitivity of the classified material has complicated congressional oversight. The dispute highlights tensions between secrecy, accountability, and political trust in national security institutions.

replies.author: CivicsNerd
replies.text: TRANSLATION: Tulsi Gabbard is exposing actual vote fraud, and is close to exposing more, so us, and our friends are getting scared and need to do some misdirection.

replies.author: HistoryBuff
replies.text: More likely selling US intel to Russia.

author: PoliticsDaily
text: President Trump has ordered the Kennedy Center to close for two years, reigniting controversy over the future of the landmark cultural institution in Washington.
aiSummary: The Kennedy Center will shut down for an extended period following a directive from President Trump, a move critics view as politically motivated and supporters frame as necessary restructuring. The decision adds to broader debates over federal influence on cultural institutions.

replies.author: TruthGuard
replies.text: Trump wants to own every building in America and have his name on every bulding in America

replies.author: Watcher
replies.text: Trump closes Kennedy Center amidst declining visitation due to his marking the edifice with his own name. Trump believes in this way he can cover up the public rejection of his shameful desecration of a once popular and honorable memorial to JFK.

author: wowsomuchpolitics
text: House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-Louisiana) said he is confident Republicans will secure enough support to end the partial government shutdown by Tuesday.
aiSummary: Speaker Mike Johnson expressed optimism that House Republicans can resolve the ongoing partial shutdown, though divisions within the caucus remain. The outcome could shape negotiations over spending priorities and party leadership going forward.

replies.author: Ant Hooper
replies.text: Don’t cave to the Left. Hold fast to what is right.

replies.author: Andreas
replies.text: Johnson is on the way out... Republicans are starting to run after the Texas loss on Saturday.

replies.author: JimBoot
replies.text: Mike Johnson's confidence in knowing what his caucus will do is as reliable as his confidence in knowing what unhinged nonsense Trump will post online at 2am on any given day.

author: USPolitics
text: A federal judge ruled that a 5-year-old boy detained by ICE alongside his father should not remain in federal custody, amid broader scrutiny of child detentions under President Trump’s immigration crackdown.
aiSummary: A judge ordered the release of a young child held by ICE, drawing attention to the administration’s use of family detention in immigration enforcement. The case has intensified debate over humanitarian standards, legal limits, and the scope of deportation policies.

replies.author: RFKStan
replies.text: I hope his family sues for every penny they can get. Poor kid. I hope he isn’t totally scarred for life from this experience

replies.author: Heritage83
replies.text: He belongs with his family, and his family belongs in their home country, NOT HERE.

replies.author: NYCInsider
replies.text: MAGA is furious kids are being released from jail
